ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I gained a larger insight into the intellectual happenings of the 20th century, especially around cultural critique and the intersections of art, literature, and politics
Literary criticism, cultural criticism, the NY intellectuals
Great joy of reading
I learned about the lives and works of the New York Intellectuals and how their work is still relevant today.

Honestly, I'm not sure that I learned anything from this course. I am unsure what to say when people ask me what it is about. From my independent research about the group called the New York Intellectuals, there is some content to be learned, but this class had no structure.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Mordechai is an incredibly interesting instructor, and is a definite strength of the course. Given his pedagogy, he doesn't exactly have hard deadlines or assignment structures, so if you're someone who needs clearer guidelines, this might not be for you.
Strength: Mordechai really engages the students in the seminar. Weakness: some readings are too long for me to meaningfully engage with it
I really enjoyed this course and the breadth of content that we covered.
Good engagement

Strengths: engaging discussion, worthwhile readings
Weaknesses: Lack of structure sometimes made expectations for the course unclear

The only strength of this course is that it was very easy because there were few assignments. The weaknesses are that I learned nothing and overall this course felt like a waste of my time. The classroom environment was also quite hostile.

We had great discussions and I feel like I learned a lot. I was always extremely engaged and the two hours flew by. I wish the professor had given me more feedback on my work. I also wish the class environment made it easier to speak up without feeling like it was only worth speaking if I had a perfectly thought-out and well formulated contribution. I also felt like the professor already had an opinion on many of the readings and there was a right opinion to have and a wrong opinion.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. Mordechai's teaching style is very unique
Yes, it is full of fascinating discussions and readings.
Absolutely this course changed the way I thought about learning at Yale and I am so grateful for it
Yes
I would highly recommend this course to another student, especially those interested in the way our views of art and culture have been cultivated in the past century.
If you can commit to doing all of the readings and taking part in discussion, yes.
I would absolutely not, although it is definitely an easy A. I took this course because the reviews for Mordechai were great, but I disagree.
Looking for low workload high intellectual engagement yes. However I dont know what skills I gained from the class since I got no feedback.
